Carly took a moment to grieve before coming back to reality; today was an important interview with the scientists behind Fortune, the revolutionary Momentum-regulating program that improved the stability of Momentum, whilst giving a big boost to Neo Domino City's appliances. She specifically was picked for the interview because of her friendly relationship with Yusei Fudo, head scientist and former WRGP and Fortune Cup champions; admittedly though, nobody else wanted to sit through the boring science talk when they had important duels they could be covering. Carly made her way up the steps to the front door before ringing the intercom. There was a brief pause, before a female's voice came out the other end.

"Hello, do you have an appointment?"

"Uh, yes, hello?" Carly flashed her press badge to the camera. "I'm Carly Nagisa from Neo Domino Weekly, I'm here for the interview today with the Fortune developers?" Another pause.

"One moment please." The call was cut off, and in a few minutes, Carly was greeted at the door by a rugged-looking man in a labcoat.

"Hello there, Miss Nagisa, I'm Dr. Fuuga, one of the researchers on the Fortune project. If you'd like to come inside, we can begin discussing the questions you'll be asking." Carly looked over the scientist's shoulder, puzzling him. "Is there something wrong?" Carly stammered backwards, thrown out of her own little world by the question.

"Oh no! Nothing's wrong! It's just, uh, I was wondering if Dr. Fudo was here today is all. We kinda go way back."

"Ah, I see, I think I remember one of the articles on Team 5Ds had your name on it as the author. Unfortunately, Dr. Fudo isn't in today, we made him take a vacation so he didn't overwork himself, that man works like a freight train! He said he would be over in Satellite visiting the orphanage today."

"Aaaaand my unlucky day begins..." Carly fixed her glasses in slight irritation before walking inside the building. She whipped out her notepad and begun asking Dr. Fuuga the questions that she prepared. "Um, I guess we should start now, if that's okay. So, uh...What exactly bought you on to this team in the first place? And uh, if you could ask Dr. Fudo to e-mail his answers to me too, that'd be appreciated."

"Certainly. Please, come with me and I'll show you the project's applications." The two began walking down the long, waxed hallway. "For me personally, I always had a fascination with physics since I was a child. I always pondered the nature of energy flow, and how it could be used to..."

What went on for about 6 hours Carly felt like it went forever, she absolutely could not keep up with the scientific terms presented to her, and at about the second hour, she gave up trying to write everything down and opted to use a tape recorder instead. Which quickly jammed, forcing her to write again. She cursed the fact Yusei wasn't here today, as she could've taken a breather to talk about dueling, life after Team 5Ds, Jack Atlas - the real stuff people, and her, wanted to read about. Dr. Fuuga hit some buttons on a terminal and ended a presentation on a screen; what was it about? Carly was too busy daydreaming to notice.

"So, Miss Nagisa?" Carly snapped out of La-La Land and fumbled to keep face. "That should end the presentation on Fortune's benefits and how Momenum will continue to be used in the future, have I answered your questions fully?" Carly begun to realize that she never paid attention during the video seminar, and inwardly began to panic.

"Omigod omigod omigod, I'm going to get fired! Think Carly, think! Ask something new and interesting to at least pay this month's rent!" Carly looked around the lab, looking for something to point out so she could ass-pull her way through this interview. Her eyes affixed to a silver laser-looking contraption, and she pointed at it with such force that one would think she was looking for a murderer. "Hey, what's that thing?"

"Oh, that?" Dr. Fuuga replied, "That's just an old scrapped experiment, we built it for the use of Momentum to stimulate plant growth."

"Ah ha! Gardening section, eat your heart out!" Carly moved closer towards it, with the doctor following close by. "Interesting. Why scrap it? Were there problems within the design, or something?"

"You could say that." The good doctor replied. "We just couldn't get any of the subjects to stimulate after continued weekly exposure to the Momentum beam, and by the time we pondered it, we all reached headway on Fortune, so we abandoned the project in favor of that, as the benefits of Fortune were far greater."

"In theory, if you begin working at it again, could you like, stop world hunger or something?"

"Perhaps. Provided you think it's a good idea to get back to work on it that is. We always love to hear from the citizens of Neo Domino the work that we should be doing to improve everyone's lives." Jackpot, meal-ticket.

"Yeah, totally! It would be really cool to have super huge potatoes and stuff, and I'm sure it could benefit the rest of the world too!"

"Well, if that's how you feel, then we'll keep that in mind."

"Understood, thank you for the interview today, Dr. Fuuga!" Carly shook his hand, and the doctor began to make his way to the door. Carly spun around in place, imagining having her name tied to a important world peace tool. "And the Nobel Peace Prize goes to...Mrs. Carly Nagisa-Atlas! Famous reporter and duelist wife! I like the sound of that already"!

As Carly danced in place, she slipped on a glob of wax on the floor, sending her flying backwards into the table holding the laser in place. Carly was first to hit the floor with a booming "THUD!", and the laser was soon to follow; to contraption shook violently as it hit the floor, before shooting a rainbow-colored beam that struck Carly in the chest. Carly felt tingly all over and begun to see stars; as her vision got less blurry, she saw the laser smoking and sputtering. Dr. Fuuga ran over to help Carly off the ground.

"Miss Nagisa, are you hurt?"

"Omigod, omigod! I'm so sorry! I broke your laser beam! Please don't hate me, please don't sue me!" The doctor put his hands on Carly's shoulders.

"Steady, steady, breathe slowly, nobody's mad at you. That laser was in it's juvenile days of development, and we have the files all backed up to the supercomputer, in fact, I'm glad you broke it, it means we can start fresh and correct any errors we had!" Carly still shuffled, looking concerned.

"I...wasn't imagining that, right? That that laser hit me?"

"I did see a flash, I can't tell if it hit you or not, but you shouldn't worry, we've calibrated that laser for plant cells, the particles of Momentum should've just jolted you is all. I'm more concerned about your legs, you look like you took a nasty spill. Can you walk?"

"Yes, no, I think I'm feeling fine..." Carly tied to shake off the dizziness in her head as se begun to stretch her legs.
123.title: Scoop of the Century

choices: Carly quickly wakes up and notices she's getting larger by the second
Carly wakes up and notices she's gotten noticably taller
Carly wakes up, noticing no changes to her body
1233.content:
Carly double-checked herself; the doctor was right, she did feel a jolty sensation in her chest, but that was about it, it was her rear that really stung as she patted it down, no doubt that was because she hit the floor hard. Carly felt doubts she would be okay, as the haunting words of her fortune still commanded her mind, but she would have to shake it off either way, she still had work to do. Brushing herself off, she rotated her neck all around and hopped in place, trying to shake free the bad vibes; Dr. Fuuga took notice.

"Are you, uh, sure you're okay to drive?"

"Oh, no," Carly replied, "I took transit down today, I think I should be fine." Carly fetched her little reporter's bag and begun to leave the room, Dr. Fuuga in tow. "Thank you for your time, Dr. Fuuga, I hope that Fortune can continue to make Neo Domino a better place to live, and good luck on that plant laser-thingy too!" With a childlike wave, which Dr. Fuuga returned, Carly left the building, looking confident and full of bluster as the doors opened to the world around her.

All that bluster melted away as the doors shut, Carly hung her head as she descended the steps of the laboratory, mulling over what she did wrong during the interview over what she did right. "Augh, stupid, stupid!" she chanted, "First you don't even pay attention, and then you go and break expensive-looking equipment? You go Carly, you're a real winner." Carly sighed as she hit the sidewalk level, she couldn't just go back to the office with literally nothing to talk about, she had to take off and go back home to at least see if she could make something the public would want to read. Carly whined and pulled out her holo-phone, shifting her way through her contacts slowly. "I'm gonna get yelled at..." Carly hit the dial button over her boss's name, and after a while, the short, middle-aged man appeared on the projected screen.

"Carly!" he shouted, with the ferocity of a tiger. "You're late! You were supposed to be at the office 30 minutes ago, why are you still over at the lab?!"

"I'm sorry sir!" she replied, "The interview went on a little too long, and then there was this accident, and uh, I-"

"Alright, whatever! Just get over here and get back on the computers! You got 2 days before we start printing next week's papers, I need that story ASAP!" Carly gulped, here came the hard part.

"Um, sir...?"

"What is it now?"

"If it's okay, could I just go home instead, and work from-"

"What?!" he shouted, not bothering to let her finish, "There better be a damn good reason why you can't work here like the rest of us!"

"I'm sorry! It's just that, well, I had a little spill on the floor over here, and I think I injured myself, so I was thinking I should probably work at home, where I can wrap a blanket around my injured little body, you know? Hee-hee..." Carly's boss didn't look happy. "Please don't fire me!" she thought.

"...Fine! You're cutting into your vacation time, but what do I care?" Carly pumped her fist in victory. "But! I want you here before we even open tomorrow, got it?! And what you have better be friggin' good!" With that, Carly's boss hung up, she could feel the anger from the other side of the line. Carly sighed and shuffled her way to a bus terminal; she sat down on the bench, and felt a little stinging pinch in her rear as she sat.

"Ow...!" Carly rubbed her backside, still feeling the dull pain from her nasty spill. "What kind of janitors do they have over there anyways? Today's just been nothing but horrid luck..." Damn Chee, why did she have to draw that one? Carly liked to believe she was a princess sometimes, cursed by a witch to have constant misfortune whenever she had something good happen to her; land her dream job, get a boss from hell, learn how to duel like a pro, almost get killed by a crazy psychopath, become head reporter for the WRGP, robots start destroying the city. Carly could only await the day with impatience her prince would come and break the witch's curse. Her strong, blond, duelist pro of a prince...

"Lady, you gettin' on?" Carly opened her eyes and fumbled around the terminal. She locked eyes with the bus driver before her, he was looking at her like she was a crazy person.

"Um, yes! Here you go!" Carly gave the elderly-looking man a wad of bills and took the seat in the far back of the bus; very few people were on, so at least she could daydream in slight solitude. The bus began to move again, and Carly went back to daydreaming about her fantasy lifestyle...

----------

Carly kicked open the door of her apartment and flopped over on the couch, panting and sweating; she ran about 15 blocks back home after she realized she fell into a nap on the bus and missed her stop. She moaned and groaned into the pillow, musing over the fact she'd have to move once more to get to her work-desk, the table. Her legs ached with serious intensity, she didn't want to move, but she had to, for the sake of her job.

"Come on girl!" she shouted, "These pains are nothing compared to the pains of unemployment!" Carly forced herself to get off the couch and stumbled slowly over to her table; she sat down on a most uncomfortable wooden chair and brushed away the empty cups of ramen from her special reporter's tool, the laptop. There it sat, the black prism that would make all her troubles go away, how she sung it's name with such bliss and glee; laptop, o laptop! Carly flipped open the screen, filling in her login info into the boxes; upon entry, the cute picture of the Fortune Fairies, all frolicking and playing amidst a soft, pink background shot up, small programs, word documents, and pictures dancing around the scene, bunched together in their labeled invisible boxes. Carly whipped out her notepad, opened the word program, and begun to record her thoughts.

She had a paragraph done in about 3 hours. The moon was already beginning to overtake the sunset. Half of what she had on her notepad were doodles and squiggles. Carly, for the lack of a better term, was totally screwed. The green-haired girl removed her glasses, revealing her beautiful gray eyes, and banged her head against the table multiple times, whining about her poor luck.

"This is it..." Bang! "I'm gonna get fired..." Wham! "I'll have to start blogging and living off candy bars..." No loud noise, just a slump. Carly felt a snugness in her back as she continued to slouch, which she determined to be her brown, fluffy vest. She removed the article of clothing and chucked it over to her couch, returning to her slump.

"Why do these things happen to me?" Carly thought aloud. "Is it just a big constant that Clumsy Carly needs to screw at least one thing up? One major thing that ruins her whole day?" Carly blamed herself for a moment, then started to blame everyone but herself. "Stupid boss, for giving me a tough assignment. Stupid Yusei, having to overwork himself and be so smart. Stupid Jack, for making me daydream about him..."

Carly tilted her head up, and her eyes danced over to the picture of Jack and her when they went to the amusement park together, squinting to make up for her lack of her glasses; Carly looked happy as a clam, whilst Jack maintained his dull stoicism that was trademark of his King persona. Yet, Carly knew, she knew that beneath that stoic man, the prideful man who's hurt feelings and ruined dueling careers on the way to the top, there was a kind man who put his honor and burning soul into his duels, into his daily routine, and would never seek to hurt a friend intentionally - that was the Jack Atlas she knew. Carly smiled and went back to slouching.

"Oh, I could never stay mad at you, Jack..." Carly shut her eyes for a moment and tried to power nap, by the time she woke up, she would feel refreshed as usual and power out her work, just like she's done in the past, just like Jack would have done. As Carly's senses begun to rest, she didn't notice the feeling of her shirt ripping, slight tears showing small areas of skin and her bra strap...
1233.title: Unlucky Lady

choices: Carly's growth stops and she looks around for cover on her way to Yusei
Carly's growth continues as she barrels down the streets
12331.content:
Carly felt restless and uncomfortable in her sleep, her good dreams were slowly beginning to crumble. It was the usual dream, she ran her own newspaper and was the fair, kind, caring boss lady of the whole company; everyone looked up to her as a pillar of wisdom, hard work, and friendship. She sat at her fancy desk, with her fancy clothes, in her fancy chair, ready to take some important calls; as she reached for the phone, her arm felt very uncomfortable, and she heard an audible rip. She looked down at her figure and saw her clothes beginning to tear - her blouse was ripping at the seams, her shoes were beginning to burst, and her pantyhose-covered underwear peeked out from her ever-shrinking miniskirt. As she felt the constraint of her clothes inscreasing, the chair gave under Carly's increasing weight, and she hit the floor, rump-first, with a hard "THUD!"

"Ow ow ow ow!" Carly cried as she came back to reality. It was the same boring apartment, same boring clothes, same boring...broken chair? Carly looked puzzled for a minute, she wanted to chalk it up to poor woodwork, but it couldn't have been that, she had that same chair for years; Carly inpected the broken mess, finding it odd that the chair's pegs had broken off, and the seating had been cracked down the middle, as if it gave into a large weight. "I haven't been gaining weight, have I?" Carly's investigative journalism was interrupted by the same constriction she felt during her dream, she looked down at her body, squinting to reduce the blur of her vision; her eyes grew wide at what she saw.

Carly's clothes had holes and tears all in them; her shirt had given way to make a hole exposing her cleavage, her jeans had begun to fray at the edges, whilst her zipper and button struggled to stay on, and her shoes were beginning to bust, the pretty pink fabric coming undone from the white rubber in fraying, manic bursts. Carly stood up, feeling wobbly as she rose, trying to get a better grasp of the situation; upon her fully erect posture, Carly noted from across the room, she had surpassed the height of her fridge by a few inches. The reporter girl gasped for air as she watched the difference between her and her fridge slowly dwindle, and she could feel the hard metal of her jeans button dig into her pelvis. After a short while, the button popped off with an audible snap and launched into the sink cupboard, digging itself into the wood; the pressure release caused Carly to crouch, partially in pain and relief, as her zipper came undone and broke away, exposing her blue-and-white striped panties to the air around her. Carly was completely frightened, a couple thoughts ran through her mind, mainly of who to call for help, but all she could manage was a cry of help to no one:

"What's happening to me?!?!"

SHRRRIIIP! Carly could feel her shirt and pants begin to give way faster, splitting from arm and leg-length upwards, exposing more skin. Even at her crouching height, she could feel her head begin to dig into her ceiling, forcing her to sit down as she continued to grow. Carly panicked, she panicked, panicked, and panicked some more; after a short while though, she began to think, she had to use her brain to get out of this situatiom, one way or another, and find a way to make things right again like usual. As Carly slowly breathed, she felt time begin to slow for her, the tearing fabric came less and less frequently, and she felt herself getting bigger and bigger less and less; she was in her journalist's nirvana, where her split-second thinking had always gotten her out of danger.

"Okay girl, calm down! Don't panic! You have to think about this, slowly and carefully." 0.250 seconds. "Okay, this can't be real. This can't be real, but it totally is, so think! Where did this come from?" 0.500 seconds. "Let's see, was it something I ate? No, can't be, I was eating the same ramen as usual. Chemicals in the water? No, I would've heard something about it. Come on Carly, think!" 0.750 seconds. "...Holy crap, it was that laser! 'Calibrated for plants' my butt!" 1.00 seconds, time resumed. "Alright I need to get in contact with them!"

Carly dashed for her phone to reach the lab on speed-dial, she was glad she never deleted any of her interviewees' contact information. As she reached across the table, Carly begun to feel her shoulders break through the fabric of her shirt, and in the short span of time past the feeling, Carly's shirt gave way, keeping connected at her stomach, but exposing her bra to the air around it. Carly tried to dial her phone, but realized her fingers were too big to navigate the menus with the buttons. "Oh no! Not good!" Almost in response to her proclamation, Carly's shoes gave way, and the socks were soon to follow, her toes peeking out through the fabric that ever shrank around her.

Carly felt defeated, but in her gray, vision-impaired eyes lied determination, a burning soul she would claim to have inherited from Jack. Carly shook off her feeling of defeat and thought; she thought and thought and thought, quickly, and effiecienty, before arriving at her answer. "The voice commands!" Carly held her massive thumb down on the button, feeling her shirt finally break apart and her head dig into the ceiling for what felt like forever, before she heard the confirmation beep. "Phone! Please call the Neo Domino Momentum Research Laboratory!" The waiting felt like forever, but the phone soon returned a computerized man's voice.

"Okay. Calling." Success! Carly shifted and pumped her fist, and in that motion, she could feel her jeans come undone. As the dial tone rang, Carly looked down at herself and blushed; she was now a 15-foot mini-giantess in nothing but her underwear, she would be so embarassed if somebody saw her like this. The phone stopped ringing, before a female voice picked up on the other line.

"Hello, welcome to the Neo Domino Momentum Research Laboratory. We're sorry, but we are closed for the day. Our office hours are-"

"WHAT?!" Carly felt a bra strap come undone from her shoulder as she yelled. "What kind of a lab has office hours?!" Another strap. Carly sat in despair for a minute, before she had another idea. "Phone, call Yusei Fudo! Quickly!" Another wait for confirmation, Carly felt her panties dig into her crotch, and she moaned in response, this was hardly the time or place for that feeling, and she didn't want Yusei to think this was some sort of prank. In a swift motion, Carly grabbed her panties and tore them from her crotch, throwing the slightly soaked fabric into her bedroom; her bra came fully undone at this motion, and she was left stark naked and ever expanding in her own apartment. Carly blushed and backed her long, green hair against her window, hoping nobody was peering inside at this scene until this point. The voice returned.

"Okay, calling." The ringing felt like forever, and Carly could feel her heart beating quicker and quicker as she waited, she really hoped she wouldn't get a voice-mail. The ringing stopped, and time felt like it froze.

"Hello, this is Yusei." Carly let out a breath of air and moved her phone close to her face; she only just realized Yusei didn't have a holographic model, and thus, couldn't see her naked - what great luck!

"Hi, Yusei, this is Carly, I uh have a little problem and I really need your help and-"

" Carly, slow down. What is the problem? Where are you right now?"

"No no, it's fine! Where are you right now?"

"At Zora's garage. Do you need me to come to you?"

"NO! No, don't do that, I'll come to you! Make sure the garage's back door is open!"

"Carly, you aren't making any sense. What is the problem?"

"It involves your lab, you see-" Carly's conversation was interrupted as she felt the floor begin to give under her weight, she could feel the dip in the floor begin to sink lower and lower. "Oh crap." A hole to the floors below opened up, and Carly fell through it, falling what felt to her like just a few feet. "Eek!"

"Carly? What's wrong? Carl-" The line cut off, and Carly looked in her palm for the answer; her phone was broken, crushed to pieces by her expanding palm.

"No! Come on! I just bought that new model too!" Carly began to shoot up through the floors of her apartment, going through her place on the 5th floor up to the 6th, the 7th, the 8th, her arms and legs shot into adjacent walls and rooms; she had no way of knowing, but she knew deep down that she was waking everyone up, and they would innevitably see her like this - she only hoped she didn't accidently hurt anyone or worse as she continued to grow. Taller and taller she rose, and Carly closed her eyes shut tightly...

Anyone from the streets could tell something was up as they saw the apartment complex's frontal wall begin to expand outward. Those who watched were treated to seeing a massive arm burst through the walls, and another, followed by a leg, before a 60 foot naked woman burst through the entire building face. Carly opened her eyes, looking around at the scale of everything compared to her in awe, before she finally took notice of the people below her, staring. Eyes wide, mouth curvy, and face beet-red, she slammed her arms into her breasts and crotch to cover her privates and buckled her knees in embarassment, not knowing what to say. Carly felt motion around her, and saw her neighbors in the apartments below shuffling around her, moaning in pain and sleep deprivation and staring up at her. Carly couldn't take the shock anymore; she leapt out of the rubble, turned, and took off down the highway - those in witness heard her loud cry:

"I'M SORRYYYYYY~!!!"
